snippet: Once revered for being “free as air and water” and for its selective application process, Cooper Union in the East Village has increased tuition and accepted a higher percentage of students than in previous years.
abstract: Cooper Union, which announced in 2013 that, beginning in 2014 it would charge undergraduate students tuition for the first time in school's history, releases figures that show overall applications are down by just over 20 percent.
lead_paragraph: Once revered for being “free as air and water” and for its selective application process, Cooper Union in the East Village has increased tuition and accepted a higher percentage of students than in previous years.

headline.main: Applications Fall and Admission Rate Rises as Cooper Union Charges Tuition
headline.print_headline: Applications Fall and Admission Rate Rises as Cooper Union Charges Tuition

keywords.value: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
